reviewText: Nostalgic journey back down football's GOLDEN past!With few exceptions, it reminds what was good about football at its' best.As ever, NFL Films is the peerless "scribe" stunningly recording most of football's uniquely enthralling moments.
Title: The Greatest NFL Players and Coaches

reviewText: i read the other reviews before i purchased this, and i was not disappointed! i can say i actually learned something from this video! All i wanted was to be entertained and i got that and more! oh yea, sorry got off track, if you like football no matter which team you root for, just get this.
Title: The Greatest NFL Players and Coaches

reviewText: all here - wow- Namath, Unitas, jim brown, al davis, madden, shula, perfect season of dolphins, earl campbell, dorsett, montana, geo allen, sayers, and on and on.buy it - great for a pre-game party video.
Title: The Greatest NFL Players and Coaches

reviewText: The DVD was very interesting, but is missing some key players and information.  Also, I expected a bonus feature or something where you could examine statistics and player bios.  That was not present.However, if you are looking to start an NFL Films collection you should certainly get this DVD.  Only steer clear if you have multiple others as it will be a repeat of a lot of information/highlights
Title: The Greatest NFL Players and Coaches

reviewText: Most of these turn out to be disappointing but not so with this one. It was done very well and will not let you down. Buy it, you will be glad you did. Buy two, give one to a friend.
Title: The Greatest NFL Players and Coaches

reviewText: I never get tired of watching Football, I can watch it alll the time. this collection is a Historic take through Some  of the Greatest Players&Coaches who have made the game incredible. this collection breaks down Players into various categorys. it is a Must have.
Title: The Greatest NFL Players and Coaches

reviewText: Even though I bought this item a few months back it is still a nice, inspirational and motivational DVD to watch. I am so happy that they showed Barry Sanders who was my inspiration as a teenager. And how can anyone forget that graceful catch by Lynn Swann. This DVD brings you in categories of hall of famers from the past and the players who would be inducted in the future. Although I enjoyed the Greatest Superbowl DVD a little more, this DVD is a must for all NFL fans. The only disappointment some people may have is not seeing current stars like Peyton Manning and Tom Brady on this DVD.
Title: The Greatest NFL Players and Coaches

reviewText: Wow.  If you like football and want to learn a lot, get this DVD.  It is long and will provide you with a great education on the early days of the NFL.  Most of the players and coaches I either saw or knew of; some I had never heard of.  The old films were neat and added a lot.  This is a must for true diehard NFL fans.  Watch this with your Dad and Granddad; they'll probably have some stories to add in.
Title: The Greatest NFL Players and Coaches

reviewText: I ordered this for my dad who is the ultimate football fan. He loves this and reviews it with friends and by himself, and he shares it too.
Title: The Greatest NFL Players and Coaches

reviewText: For fans of the current National Football League, which is now far and away the most popular professional sporting league in American history, it is often difficult to imagine a time when not every game (or any game) was on TV, and not every second was scrutinized by round-the-clock media coverage.  This DVD takes fans back to a simpler time and gives a nice little history lesson on some of the players, coaches, and personalities that paved the way for the success the league enjoys today.Though technically out to document the "greatest NFL players and coaches", this DVD in all actuality focuses primarily on players from the 1950s, 60s, and 70s (or even earlier) and gives them their "fair due" in an age when fans often times don't care about the rich history of the game.  Though I knew most of the names, it was still interesting to put a face to them, see them in action and hear their thoughts about playing the game they loved.  Names like Red Grange, Jim Brown, Otto Graham, and Gale Sayers may not resonate with young fans, but this program shows how truly important they were in terms of popularizing televised football.Usually, it is only baseball that gets a good reputation for having a rich, vibrant history dating back many, many years, but this show proves that football has an interesting past of its own.  Thus, I would recommend this DVD to any football-lovers out there.  Older fans will become awash in nostalgia, while younger viewers will be treated to a history lesson about the game they currently obsess over.
summary: A Great History Lesson For More Recent Fans
Title: The Greatest NFL Players and Coaches
